intro: Oswalda baillierioides, commonly known as the New Zealand mistflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along streambanks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Oswalda baillierioides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
